loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a public school professional teacher living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She provides education to young children between the ages of seven and ten. She teaches a maximum of four hours a day and switches between morning and afternoon shifts every other month. From this valued work, she can earn a decent income to live on. So she decided to get involved in another business, raising pigs, in order to make additional income for the household. Now she is forty-one years old, married, and has two school-age children. Hem has been a client of HKL for two years and it’ll be her second loan. 

She would like to use the loan to purchase an additional plot of rice field to so she can expand and increase her rice production in the coming years. She can sell her rice for profit if she is able to maintain a fruitful harvest annually. Hen will save her increased income for her children's future education and for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of rice field so she can expand and increase her rice production in the coming years.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim has spent most of her life cultivating rice to generate an income for the family. She tried hard through the business to pursue a better quality of life. She is married to her husband who works in the same type of business but they don’t have any children yet. They wish to have a child soon. Presently they live in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.

As of now, Khim would like to borrow a loan to purchase a piece of land to further expand her business and thereby increase her rice production. Her business goal is to own extensive farmland producing a high output, so that she can get involved in another business: trading rice in her commune.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to further expand her business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a forty-six year old married man. He has six children. He operates a farm business where he sells products such as maize, eggs, local birds and cows. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is the stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. His business goal is to expand the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy a plot of his own and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 39 лет, воспитывает 2 детей.   В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Назгул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Назгул, ее хозяйство на сегодня приносит  около 15,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazgul is 39 years old and raising two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1998 with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Nazgul's persistent and hard work, today her business yields about 15,000 som (KGS) in monthly profit from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Nazgul requested a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар мужчина в возрасте 34 лет.Он женат имеет троих детей.Он торгует бытовой техникой в местном рынке.Его дети  помогают ему в его бизнесе.Он занимается этим более 10 лет.Акбар покупает товары с рынка «Авган базар» г. Худжанда и продает их на  местном рынке. Его жена домохозяйка.Она занимается домом и детьми.Только Акбар один приносит доход и очень трудится чтобы достойно вырастить своих детей.Акбар кредитуется с 2006 года в нашей организации,На полученный кредит Акбар хочет купить пару штук бытовой техники и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Akbar is a 34 year-old man.  He is married and has three children.  He sells household appliances at the local market.  His children help him in this business.  Akbar has been involved in this business for over ten years.  He buys merchandise at the "Afgan bazar" in the city of Khujand and sells it at the local market.  His wife is a homemaker.  She takes care of the house and children.  Only Akbar brings home an income and works hard to provide a good upbringing for his children.  Akbar has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2006.  He wants to use this loan to buy a pair of household appliances and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a fifty-four-year-old widowed woman. She has five children whose ages range from twenty to thirty-four. She describes herself as diligent. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits such as mangoes etc. Her business is located within a fast growing slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruits. Her business goal is to be a supplier of fruits within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a plot and build rental houses .

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a thirty-three year old married man. He has a daughter who is eight months old. He describes himself as an effective and efficient man. He operates a retail stall where he sells items such as milk and bread. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a fast-growing slum area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be customers delaying payments. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy milk and bread. His business goal is to own a business premise where he can operate his business.

loans.use: to buy milk and bread.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a 40-year-old married woman. She has five children ranging from 11 to 24 years old. She describes herself to be diligent and efficient. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a fast growing slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be customers delaying payment. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a cooking machine for cooking chips. Her business goal and dream is to run a hotel.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cooking chips.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Margaret has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Margaret does her business in the market. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.

The main business challenges for Margaret include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to build her own house. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a 38-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 4 to 8 years old. He describes himself to be God fearing and focused on his work. He operates a bicycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a very busy area and his primary customers are students and people going to a nearby town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area, especially at night. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new bicycle to increase his transportation services. His business goal is to improve his business. He hopes that in the future, he will own a taxi for transportation services .

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, one of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two relatives). Madina has a beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Madina sells her products in a shop by means of retail. Madina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Madina include thieves and the ever-increasing prices of cream relaxers. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and to build rental rooms. Madina lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother-in-law). Amina has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days a week. Amina sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Amina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling airtime and pay phones. The main business challenges for Amina include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale and also to build her own house. 

Amina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Najminiso

texts.ru: Нажминисо 1965 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Она торгует на рынке 4 года . Начинала с продажи конфет, сейчас продает различные сладости и продукты питания. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года. Муж работает в строительной бригаде, получает заработную плату.  За счет увеличения товарооборота она улучшила свои условия жизни, и недавно выдала дочь замуж.Она  благодарна за финансовую поддержку от организации "Арванд".
texts.en: Najminiso was born in 1965.  She is married and has four children.  She has been selling at a market for four years.  Najminiso started with selling candy and now sells various sweets and food products.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2008.  Her husband works in a construction brigade and earns a salary.  Due to increased product turnover, Najminiso improved her quality of life and recently married off her daughter.  She is grateful for the financial assistance for the "Arvand" organization.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a married man. He has two children aged five and nine. He is an ambitious man. He operates a retail shop where he sells household staples  such as bread, milk, sugar, salt, flour etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as being the high prices of household goods. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of household staples. His business goal is to venture into the motor vehicle transportation services industry.

loans.use: to buy household staples.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 35 years old. She is married to a technician and they have four children aged between 3 and 16. She has been selling plastic materials for the past three years. She would like a loan to buy more plastic basins to sell. With the profits, she would like to invest more in her business. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy more plastic materials to sell.

loans.name: Naira

texts.ru:
Наира врач-стамотолог. Более 15 лет назад она открыла свою частную стомотологическую клинику. Все необходимые лекарства и инструменты Наира заказывает из Еревана. Наира высококвалифицированный специалист, и ее клиника имеет большой авторитет среди жителей  всей Сюникской области. У Наиры очень много пациентов и они записываются к ней на прием за месяц.  
Наире 41 год. Она живет в городе Капане с мужем, тремя дочерьми и с родителями мужа. Муж Наиры также работает врачом. Старшие дочери Наиры учаться в школе, а младшей всего годик. Родители мужа пенсионеры. Благодаря своему бизнесу Наира помогает мужу содержать семью.   
Наире необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для преобретения автоклава для стерилизации медицинских инструментов.
texts.en:
Naira is a dentist.  She opened her own private dental clinic over 15 years ago.  Naira orders all of the necessary medicine and equipment from Yerevan.  She is a highly qualified specialist, and her clinic is well respected among the residents of the entire Syunik region.  Naira has many patients, who have to make appointments with her a month in advance.  
Naira is 41 years old.  She lives in the city of Kapan together with her husband, three daughters and her parents-in-law.  Naira's husband also works as a doctor.  Their oldest daughters attend a school, and the youngest is only one years old.  Her parents-in-law are retired.  Thanks to her business, Naira helps her husband to support their family.  Naira needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to purchase an autoclave for sterilizing medical tools.

loans.use: to buy autoclave for medical tools sterilization

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a 51-year-old married woman who resides in Prey Chor district in Kompong Cham province. She is in the business of rice farming alongside her husband, who manages most of the maintenance in the rice field. Agriculture is the sole family income, which Chea uses to support her living and cover her daily expenses.  She has been in the business for over 20 years and has experience. She has five children, all of whom are already married and have independent living.

Due to insufficient funds to renovate her house, Chea would like to acquire a loan to buy additional needed construction supplies to start building a new house so that it will secure her family and make them feel comfortable to live in. For the future, Chea anticipates to expand and strengthen her business to attain her goal.

loans.use: buy construction supplies for a new house

loans.name: Neou

texts.en:
Neou is 54 years old and is responsible for 5 children, all of whom are single and live together with her under the same roof in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She was born and grew up there on the family farm.  That’s why crops husbandry is the main and successful activities for Neou to earn her living. Her spouse is very supportive and always helps her manage the business.

Now Neou is asking for a loan to purchase maize for farming purposes. She hopes to have a fruitful harvest from this investment and better her living condition. She aspires to uplift her family out of poverty someday through her effort and commitment.

loans.use: buy maize for farming

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a business man. He sells car spare parts to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income, he also does tailoring. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Evans has been able to grow his business and hopes to be expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy tires, side mirrors and wind screens to resell.

loans.use: buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Sarah has a business selling cell phones and accessories.  She has been in this business for over two years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cell phones, chargers and batteries. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked cell phone shop. Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister). Constance has a business selling passion fruits and orange juice. She has been in this business for a few months and she works seven days a week. Constance sells her products in the market, by means of retail. 

Constance has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruits and oranges. She also generates additional income through selling Airtime. The main business challenges for Constance include thieves and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to the villages of Kasese region to buy local gin and also to build her own house. Constance lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits and oranges.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, age 53, operates a buy-and-sell recycled material business around her community Ang Snoul in Kandal province. From this business, she is able to earn approximately USD 2.50 per day to support her living. Sam has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field to provide additional income for the family. They have been blessed with 2 school-age children who still need daily allowances from them.

With the sums of USD 700, Sam will use it to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to commute to his workplace every day without taking a taxi service any longer. Sam is very happy and grateful for the granted funds to better her living conditions.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jean D Arc is aged twenty-eight. She is married to a businessman. She has four children aged between nine months and eight years. She has been selling different items in her store for the past six years. She has requested a loan to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and eggs to sell. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in the business because many customers demand her items in bulk. In the picture, she is sitting in the head office of the bank.

loans.use: To buy more items such as flour, cooking oil and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a married man. He has two children aged two and four. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail shop where he sells household staples such as bread, milk, sugar, salt, flour etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is in a good location for his activity and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of household goods and transportation costs. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more stocks of household staples. His business goal is to venture into the transportation industry.

loans.use: to buy household staples to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 30 years old, married to a farmer, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She sells charcoal, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Claudine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell. She wants to use the profits for providing food for her family. In the future, Claudine wants to see her business prosper.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be courageous, obedient and honest. 

Charity operates a beauty saloon where she provides hair services such as blowdrying, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are women.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be sometimes she gets too few customers who come for the hair services.  

Charity will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a salon seat and more beauty products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a salon seat and beauty products

loans.name: Naman

texts.en:
Naman is a 40-year-old married man. He describes himself to be an honest and self-motivated man. He operates a business where he provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a fast growing area due to many businesses that are expanding and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be finacial constraints.

Naman will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts.  His business goal is to expand his business and create job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, quiere realizar una nueva compra de ropa americana, por esta situación solicita un nuevo préstamo, comprándose dos fardos de ropa usada, con la intensión de ofrecer a los clientes nuevos productos para la venta.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar más ingresos, pues logro realizar la compra de más mercadería, actualmente  posee un local fijo donde ofrece la ropa, su situación económica en la familia ha mejorado, dándole lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina wants to make a new purchase of clothing from the United States.  For this purpose she is requesting another loan, to buy herself two bales of used clothes, with the goal of offering her customers new products for sale.

She considers that the previous loan helped her generate more income because she managed to buy more merchandise.  Currently she has a fixed location where she sells the clothing.  Her economic situation in her family has improved, giving the necessities to her children.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothing.

loans.name: Lisseth Noemy

texts.es:
Lisseth, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, con la intensión de darle mantenimiento al negocio y poder ser más productiva, comprara leña, maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite y condimentos, ya que son los necesarios para seguir trabajando y produciendo pupusas.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, le dio los materiales necesarios para la generación de la venta, con esto asegura los ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: Lisseth seeks a new loan, intending to maintain her business and increase productivity by buying firewood, corn, pork rinds, cheese, oil and condiments, all of which are necessary to continue working to make pupusas.  She states that she had a good experience with her prior credit, which allowed her to acquire needed materials to generate sales, and assure income for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, pork rinds, cheese, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 33-year-old married man.  He is a father of three children and his fourth baby is going to come to life very soon.

Fouad's family is growing, that's why he has to make sure that his vehicle repair business is going on fine and do the best to update it with the suitable tools.  Fouad has 17 years of experience in this field, this wide experience gave him customer trust. That's why he works hard on keeping this trust.

Fouad is a hard working man with a good reputation.  He is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his  business, in addition to paying for his children school fees and paying for his wife's new baby's delivery.

This is Fouad's second experience as a Al Majmoua borrower.  His previous loan created a positive effect on his family and business at the same time, and he's sure that this one will be more effective, especially with the blessings of the newborn baby to come.

loans.use: buy tools for his business and pay costs for his children

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 30 years old and married with two children. He does motor vehicle repairs to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy side mirrors, tires and spanners.

loans.use: To buy side mirrors, tires and spanners

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is married and has two children aged seven and two. Previously, he was engaged in farming. He decided to increase his income by involving himself in the retail business which he is currently in. He sells items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, steel wire, flour etc to local residents in a fast-growing area. 

He plan to use a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more household staples. He faces a challenge related to the high prices of stock. His goal and dream is to venture into the transportation industry. Maurice describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: to purchase household staples to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who is married with two children. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 49 years old and a mother of five children. She runs a cereals store to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that place. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize, beans, rice and peas to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, rice and peas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Fiurenco

texts.en: Fiurenco is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells household goods such as bread, milk, sugar, salt, flour etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an environment conducive to the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household goods. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of household goods. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to add to his stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro, trabaja como asistente en una empresa privada que se dedica a todo lo relacionado con la belleza masculina y femenina.
El crédito lo requiere para la operación de su sobrina ya que ella tiene labio leporino.
Alvaro, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre en una casa alquilada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Alvaro Works as an assistant for a private company that devotes itself to everything having to do with men’s and women’s beauty.

He needs the loan for an operation for his niece.  She has a cleft lip.

Alvaro is single and does not have children.  He lives with his mother in a rented house in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an operation for his niece.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El señor Freddy tiene 24 años de edad estado civil soltero actualmente vive conjuntamente con sus padres, pero económicamente es independiente se dedica a la actividad agrícola en terreno de 1,4 Has que es herencia de sus padres produce papa, haba, oca con rotación de cultivos tiene mucha experiencia, está a 50 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba por lo tanto para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero además les piden muchos requisitos; se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, Freddy nos comenta que necesita dinero de urgencia para terminar la obra fina de su vivienda que ha construido, porque el ahorro que tenia de la producción a agrícola gasto en la construcción de obra gruesa, Freddy es una persona joven muy emprendedor y su sueño es tener su propia casa y concuvinarce con su enamorada que tiene, cuando tenga su casa terminada formar familia.
texts.en: Freddy is 24 and single, and currently lives with his parents but supports himself independently.  He farms a small plot of land (1,4 hectares) which his father deeded to him.  He grows potatoes, beans and oca and is experienced in crop rotation.  He lives some 50 km from the city of Cochabamba making it difficult for him to access banks, aside from the fact that they require much documentation, and he thus decided to work in this rural area.  Freddy needs funds urgently to finish a housing construction project, since his savings from his farm earnings have already been invested in the housing project. Freddy is a hardworking young man and his dream is to have his own house and start a family with his girlfriend in his new home.

loans.use: to complete housing repairs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, se dedica a la venta de ropa de varón y mujer que importa de Iquique y  vende en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más ropa y variar su mercadería para obtener más ingresos ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia.
Maria, es divorciada y tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Brasil de la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria sells men’s and women’s clothing that she imports from Iquique and sells in the city of La Paz.

The loan that she needs is to buy more clothes.  It is to vary her merchandise in order to get more income.  This is the only source of work that she has to support her family.

Maria is divorced, and she has one child.  She lives in her parents house in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto.

This is the first time that she has worked together with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity of men's and women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a carpenter who does wood-work and lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He has been involved in this trade for the last seven years. He does wood-work himself and also employs two people. 

He is married and has two school-going children. Franklin was introduced to Milango by his friend and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase an additional stock of products such as wood and nails for his business. His ambition is to open branches of his business in other areas in the near future.

The main challenge of the business is price fluctuations. He believes the income from this business will help him educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as wood and nails for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (Old parents).  Rose has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works seven days out of every week.  Rose sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 1,500.000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. The main business challenge(s) for Rose include thieves and   transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale and own a fully stocked shop. Rose lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells second-hand clothing in Adum Banso. Abena  has completed junior secondary school. She is married and has two children. Her husband works with the Benso Oil Plantation company. Abena has been selling second-hand clothing for three years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She would like to use the profit from her expanded business to acquire a shop where she can sell her clothing.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Candida Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 13 años. Este negocio lo inicio ya que le gustaba lo que era belleza entonces tomo primeramente unos cursos de belleza y luego puso su salón a pesar que tenía pequeñas diferencias con su esposo a quien no le gustaba mucho la idea.
Candida ha sido siempre de la idea de que la mujer debe trabajar y tener su propio dinero. Ella mencionó que este negocio fue una gran bendición ya que ella quedo viuda por medio de él ha logrado mantener su casa y que sus hijas se preparen. El crédito lo invertirá en tintes, alisados…etc.
texts.en:
Sra. Candida Rosa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has managed a beauty salon for 13 years. She started this business because she likes making people beautiful. Candida began by taking beauty courses and then later opened her salon despite having some minor differences with her husband, who did not like the idea very much.

Candida has always had the notion that a woman should work and have her own income. She said that this business has been a great blessing now that she is a widow and must maintain her home and prepare her children. This loan will be invested in dyes, straighteners, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy dyes, perms, nail polishes, treatments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gladis Del Transito

texts.es:
Gladis, está solicitando nuevamente un crédito, para invertirlo en el negocio de mariscos y sobre todo iniciar el cultivo de maíz, comprándose abono, herbicidas para poder dar comienzo a su actividad en la siembra de maíz.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para realizar una buena inversión en el cultivo y en la venta de mariscos, sus condiciones han mejorado, la familia no ha aumentado, pero si las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis seeks a new loan to invest in her seafood business and to begin growing corn, buying fertilizer and herbicide to start a field of corn.
A prior loan helped her better her living standards by investing in her farm and seafood sales business. Her family size did not increase, but her living conditions are much better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, trabaja  vendiendo comida en su mismo domicilio,  su esposo es jubilado rentista. 
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital ya que comprará al por mayor arroz, fideo, y otros condimentos para la elaboración de la comida que prepara y vende.
Nelly, es casada y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Nelly Works selling food from her home.  Her husband is a retired pensioner.  

The loan that she needs is to buy wholesale rice, noodles, and other condiments to make the food the she prepares and sells.

Nelly is married and has three children.  She lives with them in her own house in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, noodles, and other condiments to make the food the she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be quiet and focused. 

Elizabeth run a general store and sells household goods such as salt, sugar, tea leaves, etc. She also sells fruits such as mangoes and vegetables such as onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of goods.

Elizabeth will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase household goods to sell.  Her dream and business goal is to expand her business by selling a variety of goods. She hopes that in the future, her children will excel in their lives.

loans.use: purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Nahson

texts.en: Nahson is a married man. He has 2 children with ages from 6 months to 2 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells household goods, such as salt, sugar, tea leaves, etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a viable business environment  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of household goods. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase household goods. His business goal is to venture into the transportation industry .

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Kaziah

texts.en:
Kaziah is a petty trader.  She sells bags, jeans and shoes, which she has done for 3 years. Kaziah is a single parent and has one child. They live at Adum Bansu near Takoradi.  She uses her income to feed and clothe her child. 

Kaziah will use her loan to purchase more bags, jeans and shoes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Kaziah wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: purchase more bags, jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has a daughter who is one year old. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, bread, juice, flour, tea leaves etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a viable and conducive business environment  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of household staples. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase household goods. Samuel's dream and business goal is to diversify his business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to add to his stock of household staples.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a fishmonger in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She sells smoked fish. She has been in this business for ten years now. Abena is married to a small-scale miner. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. 

Abena will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Nana Akua

texts.en:
Nana Akua fries doughnut for sale. She also sells bread and groundnut paste in Adum-Banso near Takoradi. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. 

Nana will use her loan to purchase sugar, flour, and cooking oil for her bread and the doughnuts. With the new profit, Nana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, and cooking oil to make bread and doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a married woman. She has a daughter who is two years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, bread, juice, flour, tea leaves etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable area which is conducive for business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenges as the high prices of household staples and transportation costs. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase household staples. Her business goal is to venture into a transportation business so as to increase her income and to cut the costs of transport.

loans.use: to buy more household staples to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce Andoh sells eggs and beef at Adum Banso near Takoradi.  She has been in this business for some time now. She is a single parent and has 2 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and to pay her children’s school fees.  Joyce will use her loan  to purchase eggs and beef to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: purchase eggs and beef to sell

loans.name: Brenda Mercedes

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de una comarca del poblado de telica, su profesión es maestra de secundaria, actualmente está impartiendo clases en el instituto de la localidad con 5 años de ejercer dicha actividad, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por  2 personas ella, también es vuida  y un hijo, el que estudia en el colegio de la localidad, actualmente solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloques , cemento y cerámica con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para continuar solicitando financiamiento y cumplir con su sueño, ya que los créditos recibidos le han sido de gran impacto en mejoramiento mismo de ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from a section of the town of Telica. She is a high school teacher and currently conducts classes at a local school where she has been employed for five years. Her family consists of two people since she is a widow and has one child who attends school in the area.

She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her home. She will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, and ceramic tiles so that her conditions and standard of living can improve. The borrower came to CEPRODEL so that she could continue receiving financing and fulfill her dream. The loans she has received have had a positive impact by making life better for herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Juan Crisostómo

texts.es: Juan con su credikiva anterior compró materias primas, con las que elaboró bolsos femeninos, sandalias y las vendió a un buen precio. Está muy satisfecho porque además recibió un subsidio de vivienda en el macro proyecto Villas de San Pablo, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su programa  “Sueños y oportunidades”.  En la actualidad Juan está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará mercancías para surtir su tienda, pues abrió un nuevo negocio, ubicándolo en una esquina muy comercial , donde vende  artículos de la canasta familiar a las familias cercanas, lo cual generará nuevos ingresos para su hogar.  Ambos son negocios muy rentables y él los conoce muy bien. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradecimientos por la confianza en mi negocio” y pide que lo sigan apoyando para ampliar su tienda y cumplir sus sueños de mejoramiento de su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Juan bought raw materials, with which he made women's bags and sandals, and sold them at a good price.  He is very satisfied because he also received a housing subsidy in the Villas de San Pablo macro project, supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo's Dreams and Opportunities program.

Currently Juan is requesting another Kiva loan to buy merchandise to supply his store.  He opened a new store, locating it on a very commercial corner, where he sells staples to nearby families.  This will generate new income for his household.  Both are very profitable businesses and he knows them very well.

His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thanks for your confidence in my business."  And he asks that they continue helping to expand his store and realize his dream of improving his and his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply his store.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is single and has an eight-year-old child who has begun schooling. Doreen runs a retail shop which has been operating for six years. She employs three other people in her business. Besides this business, Doreen also earns some income from her formal employment.

Doreen was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for her second loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase milk to sell.  Her business  faces the challenge of the overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.  Her dream is to open up other business branches in the future.

loans.use: purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael  is a 45-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be social and talkative.

Michael operates a retail business where he sells items such as filters, cups , mugs, handerchiefs, calendars, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a commercial area  and his primary customers are the general public.   In addition, Michael also sells charcoal to increase his income.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints hence he is unable to improve his business. 

Michael will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy charcoal to resell.   His dream and  business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth used to sell fish but now sells gari (tapioca) in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She is married to a mason and has two children. Elizabeth has been selling gari for a year now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. 

Elizabeth will use her loan to buy bags of gari to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business she plan to acquire a shop to enable her sell her gari.

loans.use: buy bags of gari (tapioca) to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a baker. She bakes bread for sale in Adum Banso. She is married and has three children; her husband is a farmer. Agnes has been baking for three years now. She support her husband to feed and clothe their children. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business from the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. 

Lydia operates a retail store where she sells items such as  barbed wire, bread, iron sheets, flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a viable fast growing town and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. 

Lydia will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more household goods and barbed wire to sell.  Lydia' dream and business goal is to expand her retail store.

loans.use: buy barbed wire and household goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 31 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. 

Previously, Grace was involved in farming but now she operates a retail store  where she sells cereals such as maize. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a viable fast growing town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of maize. 

Grace will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell.   Her business goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She has no children yet. She is an ambitious and hardworking woman. Previously, she was involved in farming, but now she operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, steel wire, etc.   She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a viable fast growing town  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of products and stiff competition within the area. 

Lucy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household goods to sell.   Her  dream and business goal is to diversify her business.

loans.use: buy household goods to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana sells cooking utensils and saucepans. She also sells sugar and gari (cassava) in Adum Benso. She has been selling these for some time now. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver, and she supports him to pay their children's school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to build a shop where she can sell her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the coastal town of Kongowea in Kenya. He has a workshop which has been running for the last four years. From this shop, Moses sells wood and wood work.

Despite the challenge of the scarcity of products during certain times of the year, Moses intends to be a distributer of wood and wood work in the future. He is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase the stock of wood in his workshop. This is the first loan Moses is applying for since joining Milango, and he is quite ambitious of his plans for his business.  He believes the additional income from this business will enable him build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: buy wood and wood products

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is a baker, she bakes bread which she sells in Adum Banso. She is married and has three children, and her husband is a small-scale miner.  

Jenet has been baking for three years now. She supports her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery She hopes to expand her business from the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a baker, baking meat pies and bread which she sells, along with soft drinks, at Adum Banso. She is married with one child and her husband is a farmer. Akua has been baking for three years now. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of their home. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Norma quien vende comida desde hace 6 años negocio que inicio con la venta de frutas y verduras  y poco a poco fue creciendo e invirtiendo en otras cosas. Con ella trabajan dos muchachas.
Los otros integrantes son Hassell quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 3 años y Misael tiene un taxi desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group "Fe" (Faith) consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals. One of them is Norma, who has been selling food for six years. She started out selling fruits and vegetables, but she gradually grew her business and invested in other products. Norma works with two other women.

The two other members are Hazel, who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for three years, and Misael, who has been driving a taxi for ten years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, basic grains, cheese, and meat.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel,38, is married with three children. While her husband continues working as a taxi driver, Isabel contributes to the household income by working as a nanny and providing cleaning services in other people's houses. Isabel used her last loan to invest in her husband's transportation business. At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to further her own activities. Specifically, she would like to purchase cleaning supplies such as a broom, dustpan, and bucket.

While this profile is for an individual loan, Isabel is receiving her loan as a member of the village bank "Manos Juntas" (Hands Together) which meets monthly in Cusco. The city of Cusco is located at 3,400 meters above sea level in the Andean mountain range.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies such as a broom, dustpan and bucket.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica, 55, is married with two children. She alternates her daily activities between her grocery store and her business selling mistura (colored papers) which are used as decorations for parties, baptisms, and weddings. Angelica's grocery store is open from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. and at this time, she would like to increase her selection of merchandise. With her loan, Angelica plans to purchase staples such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. Angelica is grateful to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

This profile is for an individual loan, which Angelica is receiving as a member of the village bank "Manos Juntas" (Hands Together) which meets monthly in Cusco. The city of Cusco is located at 3,400 meters above sea level in the Andean mountain range.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, Yawa est une femme  qui vend de la boisson à toutes personnes désireuses de  se rafraichir chez elle. Elle est mariée à un peintre-bâtiment et a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 21ans et le dernier 13ans. Elle a démarré en 2000 son activité et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de boissons afin de satisfaire la demande des clients. Elle veut faire développer son activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 42-year-old woman who sells beverages from her home to anyone in need of a refreshing drink. She is married to a building painter, and the couple have three children aged 13 to 21. All three have received schooling. 

Yawa launched her activity in 2000, and she buys her stock in Lomé. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on beverages in order to meet customer demand. She wants to expand her activity and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Agripina; continua con la agricultura  en su rama de cereales y todo esto lo seca para venderlo como granos, la socia a mejorado sus ventas y pese a la inclemencia del clima ella pudo rescatar toda su cosecha en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el dinero para pagar el transporte que lleva sus productos que vende en la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member, Agripina, continues in agriculture in the area of cereals, which she dries to sell as seeds.  She has improved her sales and despite the inclement weather she managed to save her whole crop.

Now she wants to invest in transportation to take her products to the city of Cusco to sell.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of her products to Cusco

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa cooks konkonte for sale. Konkonte is a local dish made out of cassava.  She serves it in palm nut soup and grandnut soup. She has been in this business for 7 years now.  Theresa lives together with the husband and 5 dependents in Adum-Banso near Takoradi. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Theresa will use her loan to purchase cassava for the konkonte, meat, fish, and vegetables ingredients for her dish. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy cassava to make food to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas cooks banku for sale.  She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in Adum Banso near Takoradi.   She has done this for 3 years. 

Dorcas is married to a driver and has 2 children.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accomodation bills.  Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: buy maize and fish to make food to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia  operate a grocery shop and has done this for some years now.   The items in her grocery shop are soap, cooking oil, tin tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She is married  and has 7 dependents.  Her husband is a farmer.  

Lydia uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell.  With the new profit, Lydia  plans to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a baker.  She bakes bread for sale.  She also operates a grocery shop at Adum Banso.  Some of the items in the grocery shops are soap, tin tomatoes, and milk.   Her  husband works at the Benso Oil Plantation.  Nancy has been in this business  for 6 years now.  She supports her husband to pay their utility bills with her income.  

Nancy will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery and a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers.  She hopes to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients and grocery items

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fish vendor.   She also cooks kenkey for sale.  She buys fresh fish from the market and fries it for sale at Adum Banso near Takoradi.   She has done this for 3 years.  

Ama is married to a farmer.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accomodations bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare the kenkey and fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business

loans.use: buy maize and fish to make food for sale

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena  is a trader in Adum Banso near Takoradi. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs, onions, peppers and other items such as salted fish, salt, cooking oil, soap, ect.  Helena is married to a farmer and has 3 children. She uses her income to assist the husband to pay their children’s school fees. Helena will use her loan to purchase more vegetables and food items for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah lives together with her husband in Adum Banso near Takoradi.  Hannah sells soap and has been selling soap for 1 year now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accomodation bills. Hannah will use her loan to purchase boxes of soap to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy soap to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena, 34, lives with her partner and two children. She runs a business selling artisan products, primarily knitwear, and jewelry such as earrings and necklaces. Previously, she worked as a street vendor selling food, but decided to change her activity in order to earn more income. She has also discontinued her weekend business selling furniture in order to focus full-time on her new endeavor. Maria Elena is requesting a loan to invest in thread and merchandise such as knit sweaters.

Maria Elena is pleased to receive the loan and promises to make her repayments on schedule. She is receiving her individual loan as a member of the village bank "Manos Juntas" (Hands Together) which meets monthly in Cusco. Cusco is located 3,400 meters above sea level in the Andean mountain range.

loans.use: to buy thread and knit sweaters.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 60 years old and has several children. She sells cosmetics informally to friends, acquaintances, and neighbors through a catalog, and would like a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as lipstick, eyeshadow, and blush. In addition, Cirila continues running a hardware store which is generally open from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. In this store, she sells construction materials such as cement, bricks, nails, and paint.

Cirila is pleased to receive the loan and promises to make her repayments on schedule. She is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Manos Juntas" (Hands Together) which meets monthly in Cusco. The city of Cusco is located in the Andean mountain range, and a common transit point for tourists en route to the Incan ruins of Macchu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, eyeshadow, and blush.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been running her home-based store for seven years. She is indeed thankful because the profits she has generated from her retail business have been useful in bringing up her four children and providing for their basic needs. In addition, she is able to maintain two hectares of rice fields and provide daily livestock feed for the hogs she raises. Imelda really wants to have a continuously high income to be able to sustain the family's basic needs.

Imelda aims to educate her three children, so that they can find better opportunities as they journey through their lives. To realize this dream, she is asking for additional working capital to improve her home-based store. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to buy volumes of merchandise to increase her sales. She believes that she can make her dreams possible through the continuous improvement of her business and the financial support of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to improve her retail business.

loans.name: Manuel Alexis

texts.es:
Manuel, sigue trabajando, pero debido a su interés por cultivar maíz, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para comprarse los materiales necesarios como el abono, insecticidas, para iniciar el cultivo de maiz y aplicarlos al cultivo, espera que estos materiales le ayuden a fortalecer la plantación para poder tener un nuevo ingreso.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a reparar la motocicleta  y ha logrado mejorar la vivienda, ofreciéndole a la familia mayor comodidad, con su trabajo logro salir del primer préstamo, ahora inicia una nueva ocupación de la cual espera mejorar su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Manuel continues to work at his job, but due to his interest in growing corn, he is applying for a new loan, to buy the necessary materials such as fertilizer and insecticides. This is so that he can start growing corn, and apply them to the crop. He hopes these materials help him to strengthen the plantation, so that he can have a new source of income.

The previous loan helped him repair the motorcycle, and he has succeeded in improving his home--providing his family with greater comfort. With his job, he managed to pay off the first loan. Now he is starting a new occupation, through which he hopes to improve his family situation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya and runs a transport business. He owns a motorcycle. The business has been in operation for the last two years. In this business, Edwin employs two additional people. He is a married father of six children and one of his children is in school.

Edwin is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to add onto his savings to purchase a motorcycle. He believes this loan will improve the living standard of his family.

His ambition is to purchase more motorcycles in future and declares that there are no major challenges facing the business worth documenting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Enhsaya

texts.en: Enhsaya, 24, lives with her husband and two children in Dornogovi province, Southern Mongolia. Her husband is employed and her two children are in kindergarten. Enhsaya started a taxi service business in 2007 and she works for 8 hours from Monday to Friday. She is improving the household and increasing her income little by little. She has made regular customers in the town and now plans to develop her business activities by buying a truck. Enhsay is a young, experienced woman who says, "I would like to expand the business by purchasing a truck for the business. I am planning to deliver freights, cargo and construction materials with the truck." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy a new truck.

loans.use: to buy a new truck.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg, 37, is a widowed woman who lives with her three daughters in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. Since her husband died a year ago, she has received all the responsibilities of the family. She has been running a second-hand clothes retail business since 1995. She purchases the supplies in as large quantities as possible in order to save on transportation expenses. Sometimes, she brings in the supplies with another trader so that they share the expenses, which is good for them both. Her trading location is very good and and well located for the customers. Altantsetseg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies especially some summer clothes in wholesale. I want to increase the volume and save for the college fees of my three girls." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: to buy more garments for resale.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Amgalan, 54, is a widow living with her daughter in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. Her daughter is employed. Amgalan has been running a food store business since 2002. The business has been successful and she has been responsible for her daughter's college tuition fees. As the store is located near a secondary school, Amgalan wants to develop the business and increase the types of products she sells. She is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by purchasing the supplies in wholesale. I will keep the business successful in the future." The total amount she is requesting is 1,600,000 MNT to buy the food supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food store.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est âgée de 42 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui ont 8 et 12 ans.   Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle pratique la vente d’habits  activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais aussi dans le but de gagner des revenus et de subvenir a ses propres besoins. Par conséquent c’est la recherche du profit qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2002. Elle a déjà remboursé 6 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits destinés a renforcer  son stock de marchandises. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is 42 years old and she lives in Senegal. She is a married mother of two children aged 8 and 12. She has been working in trade for over ten years. She sells clothing, an activity chosen out of passion but also to earn income and to support herself. Consequently, the ability to generate profits is what she finds most appealing in her activity. 

She became a member of a U-IMCEC branch in 2002 and has already repaid six previous loans. 

She is seeking a loan of 500,000F to replenish her stock of clothing. An increase in profits will help her to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Vergencita

texts.en:
Vergencita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Vergencita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Vergencita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Vergencita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Willian Humberto

texts.es:
Willian, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, por que el anterior le ayudo para invertir en el negocio, esta vez comprara más ropa nueva, para damas, caballeros y niños, para salir a vender, con la esperanza de tener mejores ventas. 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener surtido el negocio, atrayendo a más clientes, sus ingresos familiares han sido mejor, no ha enfrentado ningún problema.
texts.en:
Willian is applying for a new loan, because the previous one helped him to invest in the business. This time, he will buy more new women's, men's and children's clothing, so that he can go out and sell it, with the hope of having better sales. 

The previous loan helped him keep his business stocked, attracting more customers. His family income has been better, and he hasn't faced any problems.

loans.use: To buy new women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Suhee

texts.en: Suhee is a 51-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in Western Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a college student. His wife makes traditional clothes at home and he delivers them to the customers, takes them to the neighbor provinces and trades them. They are both experienced in the field and have many regular customers and organizations. He also has a shop counter at the local biggest trade center. Suhee is a diligent man who says that, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the necessary materials for the traditional clothes so that the volume will be increased. I am planning to save for my children' future and improve the household". The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy clothing materials.

loans.use: To buy clothing material

loans.name: Rp Joegen

texts.en:
RP Joegen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
RP Joegen has a shop where she sells clothing like shirts, underwear & blouses. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more clothing to sell.

RP Joegen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga,30, lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the two children at home. Gantulga has been running a taxi service business since 2008 with his small five seater van. He has earned lots experience in the field and has already made many customers and acquaintances. He knows the routes well and that is appreciated by his customers. Now he plans to buy a truck to deliver large amounts of vegetables and agricultural products. He has done research into the business activity he is going to start. Gantulga is a responsible man who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by buying a truck with which I will deliver large amounts of products, especially in autumn. In the area where I live, there are many farmers who want to trade their products in the city." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy the truck.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, 42, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She has a retail food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. 

Julie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Brendon

texts.en:
Brendon is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Brendon has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Brendon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brendon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Audeli Paulina

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica,  su actividad es venta de comida y refrescos en general, es casada su núcleo familiar consta de 4 personas 3 hijos y su esposo, los hijos están solteros una de ella esta laborando en su especialidad, los otros están estudiando en león, esta señora tiene 10 financiamientos recibidos con la empresa , los cuales les han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, y de esa manera a apoyado al hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, dicho negocio comenzó como venta de refrescos y hamburguesas, actualmente está más amplio y mejores condiciones competitivas, en todos los aspectos, dicho negocio nació de la necesidad misma de desarrollar su familia y emprendió la ejecución de lo que hoy está establecido, actualmente está solicitando a ceprodel un nuevo financiamiento para ampliar las condiciones  de la vivienda y su negocio y de esa brindar un mejor servicio, ya que los materiales que requiere son los siguientes: Ladrillos, Cemento, Arena, Cerámica y Mano de Obra.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from Telica. Her business involves selling food and soft drinks. She is married and her family consists of four other people, three children and a husband. Her children are single. One of them is working in her career and the others are studying in León.

This woman has received 10 loans for her business and they have helped to improve her conditions and her standard of living. In addition, the loans have enabled her to maintain her home and pay for her children's studies. Her business started with selling soft drinks and hamburgers. She now has a larger business with better conditions, which has helped her stay competitive in all aspects. She started this business so that her family could develop and today she has successfully carried out her plans.

She is now requesting a new loan from CEPRODEL so that she can expand her home and business in order to provide better service. She needs to buy materials such as bricks, cement, sand, ceramic tiles, as well as pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bahbolot

texts.en: Bahbolot, 38, lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. His children study at the secondary school and his wife is employed. Bahbolot has been running a garment retailing business for a year. He is also planning to plant some vegetables with his wife. He has made some research into the field and prepared an area for agriculture. However, he needs some assistance for the business. Bahbolot is a clever man who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by purchasing seeds and the necessary equipment. My wife and I are really trying to improve our household and to save for our children's futures." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ulamsuren

texts.en: Ulamsuren is a 63-year-old man who lives with his wife in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His wife is a retiree. He started repairing cars in 2005. At that time, it was quite a new business. Therefore, he is considered to be a talented, good repairman in the town and has many regular customers. He runs the business inside the fence and supplies the best services to the customers. Ulamsuren is a hardworking man who says that, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing the necessary repairing materials so that I could offer many kinds of auto services and increase the volume. Not only the profits, but I also try to have the best services for the customers". The total amount he is requesting is 3,400,000 MNT to buy auto repairing materials for the business.

loans.use: To buy auto repair materials

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es: La Sra. Ascencía tiene 54 años,  es casada,  la Sra. Ascencía se dedica a la venta de  leche ya que tiene unas vacas que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio,  Este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ascencía utilizara este préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra.  Ascencía enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en su zona hay muchas personas que venden leche,  Ella va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar su casa y así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ascencía is 54 and married.  Ascencía sells milk, as she has some cows that she keeps at her home. This is her first loan with the institution. Ascencía will use this loan to buy a milk cow. The reason she is applying for this loan is to increase her working capital.

Ascencía faces challenges in her business, including competition, since there are many people in her area who sell milk. She is going to use the profits to improve her house, and in this way improve her whole family's quality of life. She is happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.
